Customizable features

dcl_stats_n_plots provides you with several options to customize the plot or the annotation of the statistical results. Here you can find a list of all features that can currently be customized, which follows the scheme: feature: default_value (accepted types) - description and/or additional information

General features of the plot

  • fig_width: 28 (int, float) - width of the figure in cm
  • fig_height: 16 (int, float) - height of the figure in cm
  • show_legend: True (bool) - whether to show the legend (implemented for mixed-model ANOVA plots)
  • marker_size: 5 (int, float) - size of the markers (i.e. individual data points)
  • save_plot: False (bool) - whether to write the created plot to disk or not
  • color_palette: 'colorblind' (str if one of the available matplotlib color palettes shall be used, dict if you would like to specify the colors individually for each group, where the key must be the group name and value the color name)
  • save_plot: False (bool) - whether you want to write the generated plot to disk

Features of the x- and y-axes:

  • axes_linewidth: 1 (int, float) - width of the axis (affects both x- and y-axis)
  • axes_color: 'k' (str) - color name of the axis (affects both x- and y-axis)
  • axes_tick_size: 10 (int, float) - size of axis ticks (affects both x- and y-axis)
  • yaxis_label_text: 'data' (str) - label of y-axis
  • yaxis_label_fontsize: 12 (int, float) - font size of y-axis label
  • yaxis_label_color: 'k' (str) - color name of the y-axis label
  • yaxis_scaling_mode: 'auto' (str) - whether the y-axis shall be scaled automatically according to the plot ('auto'), or whether you would like to scale it manually ('manual'). If 'manual', the y-axis upper and lower limit will be set to yaxis_upper_lim_value and yaxis_lower_lim_value, respectively.
  • yaxis_uppwer_lim_value: 1 (int, float) - upper limit of the y-axis (will only be applied if yaxis_scaling_mode is set to 'manual')
  • yaxis_lower_lim_value: 0 (int, float) - lower limit of the y-axis (will only be applied if yaxis_scaling_mode is set to 'manual')
  • xaxis_label_text: 'group' (str) - label of x-axis
  • xaxis_label_fontsize: 12 (int, float) - font size of x-axis label
  • xaxis_label_color: 'k' (str) - color name of the x-axis label

Features of the annotations:

  • distance_brackets_to_data: 0.1 (int, float) - factor that controls the distance of the brackets to the plotted data (be careful with major changes to this value - it might be useful to use the GUI to determine the optimal value)
  • distance_stars_to_brackets: 0.5 (int, float) - factor that controls the distance of the text that indicates the statistical results (e.g. 'n.s.' or '**') to the brackets (be careful with major changes to this value - it might be useful to use the GUI to determine the optimal value)
  • annotation_brackets_factor: 1 (int: must be either 0 or 1) - whether the annotation that indicates which groups were compared is a bracket (1) or a plain line (0)
  • linewidth_annotations: 1 (int, float) - width of the annotation lines (applies to both, brackets and plain lines)
  • fontsize_stars: 10 (int, float) - font size of the text that indicates the statistical results (e.g. 'n.s.' or '**')
  • fontweight_stars: 'bold' (str) - font weight of the text that indicates the statistical results (e.g. 'n.s.' or '**'), must be one of: 'normal' | 'bold' | 'heavy' | 'light' | 'ultrabold' | 'ultralight'
  • l_stats_to_annotate: [] (list) - list of pairwise comparisons whose statistical results shall be annotated (function not yet implemented)

Analysis-specific plotting & annotation functions
